direction.raw_text: For Pete's sake, Calvin!  We've got guests!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, honey!  I just got to fooling with this darn rheostat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, put it down and come in!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet, hon! They exit the workshop for the house.  Calvin has left the ham radio on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tower, Wolf One is five miles from the overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wolf One, Tower. Report the numbers. You're number one for the overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wolf one. INT. COCKPIT OF JET - SAME TIME The YOUNG PILOT looks down at the flashing red light on his control panel. He speaks into the oxygen mask that hangs loosely from his helmet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tower. Wolf One. I've got a problem here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say your problem, Wolf One. Are you declaring an emergency?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand by. One. INT. DINING ROOM DAVE, BETTY, BOB, and RUTH (30's) pass around the buffet table. Another period song is playing on the phonograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just remember: don't mention the communists!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin's a great guy, but he's a little, you know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nutty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's his wife like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you know, housewife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Likes to cook. Pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Normal, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I wouldn't go that far. (then) Helen! Helen has entered from the kitchen with more food. She favors June Allison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Betty!  Dave!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just look at you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any day now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my sister and her husband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hi! Welcome! INT. LIVING ROOM Calvin is using a cocktail shaker to very carefully make Rob Roys for the crowd at the bar. It's like watching a chemist at work. Calvin's a pipe-smoker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So anyhow this duck says to the clerk, "I'd like to buy this lip balm."  And the clerk says, "Will that be cash or a check?"  And the duck says, "Just put it on my bill!" Polite laughter follows, but the guy out of Calvin's sight-line rolls his eyes. ANGLE - DAVE AND BOB with drinks. Helen is in the b.g., rushing around, over- serving everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was the golden-boy professor at Cal Tech.  But then he starts inventing things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of things?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got me.  Some kind of special synthetic rubber.  And some kind of automated machine.  Anyhow, suddenly he gets rich.  I mean rich!  And quits teaching. ANGLE - CALVIN as his guests sample their Rob Roys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just what the doctor ordered! Calvin gives the man his patented thumbs-up sign. ANGLE - BETTY AND RUTH over by the patio doors. We can see Calvin's shop through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With all his money they could have moved to Beverly Hills, but they decided to stay in the Valley.  Calvin spends all his time tinkering out there in his workshop.  If you ask me it's all very strange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He dug a huge hole out there for a swimming pool. Then he decided he didn't want it and filled the thing in. And what's that big, high fence for? The women look at Calvin. ANGLE - CALVIN with guests (one is called Harold) at the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There currently exists a type of neon light that lasts five years.  But you won't see it on the market. Same is true of batteries. I could take your simple yacht battery and rig it to last a decade, easily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what the heck kind of a marketing system can't get great new products like that out to the public?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A veeeery good one, Harold. Free market capitalism may not be a perfect order, but it's the best we've got, or will ever have.  And why?  Three reasons! Poor Harold. INT. KITCHEN - SAME TIME Most of the guests are women, gabbing and helping Helen out as she removes a pot roast from the oven and busily jumps around the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, Helen?  What does Calvin think about this trouble down in Cuba?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, please don't bring that up! EXT. HOUSE - NIGHT, MOMENTS LATER A late guest named RON hurries up the walkway and into the house. SCENE 8 OMITTED INT. LIVING ROOM - A SECOND LATER Calvin is with another guest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd say my baseball card collection is as complete as any one I've ever seen. Ron pushes his way through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin!  Hey, Calvin! (pointing over his shoulder) Kennedy's going toe-to-toe with Khrushchev on the television! Calvin immediately heads for the family room. Others follow. INT. FAMILY ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Everyone is huddled around the JFK TV press conference. There seems to be a lot of smokers. Helen appears shortly, wearing a hot pad mitten on each hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...this sudden, clandestine decision to station strategic weapons for the first time outside of Soviet soil, is a deliberately provocative and unjustified change in the status quo which cannot be accepted by this country. Calvin cuts a knowing look at Helen who dutifully returns it. EXT. JET - NIGHT The plane swoops over the Valley and we see the spectacular lights of L.A. sprawl.  There is a TRAIL OF SPARKS coming from the jet's engine. INT. JET COCKPIT The plane is shaking terribly and the pilot is having a very hard time controlling it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wolf One -- say intentions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got secondaries of an engine fire and I'll need to find a clear area to eject.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roger, Wolf One. Can you make it to the ocean? EXT. JET The trembling plane circles to the west. INT. FAMILY ROOM Return to TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...we will not prematurely or unnecessarily risk the cost of worldwide nuclear war, in which even the fruits of victory would be ashes in our mouth.  But neither will we shrink from the risk at any time it must be faced. INT. LIVING ROOM - NIGHT/ EXT. HOUSE, MOMENTS LATER To Helen's embarrassment, Calvin is ushering  all the guests to the front door. Helen is passing out hats and purses. She and Calvin speak simultaneously - somewhere in the middle we cut outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry everyone, but given this extraordinary turn of events, I think it's prudent that we cut the evening short. I'm sure this Cuban thing will resolve itself, but in the meantime...I'd suggest taking a prayerful watch-and-wait stance!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll do this again! Maybe next week. Here's your hat. Could I wrap something up for you? Did you have a coat? Helen can barely get a "good night" out before Calvin shuts the door. ANGLE - DAVE AND BOB Following their wives out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd I tell ya?! Bob whistles softly. Calvin's a nut all right. INT. FRONT DOOR Calvin turns to Helen, a grave expression on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time? Oh, no Calvin. It's not time yet. I still have-- He points down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that time! You know Calvin, I'm not sure I'm really ready for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the contrary, I think we're the only ones who are. He leads her out of shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin I'm sure everything's going to be all right. I just know it is! EXT. BACKYARD - MOMENTS LATER Calvin and Helen leave the house; cross the patio; and hurry to the shop. Back in the house, the record player has been left on:  "How Much Is That Doggie In The Window...?"  Helen is carrying the pot roast which is wrapped in foil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm certainly not going to let the pot roast go to waste. Could you just put that seat cover back on that lawn chair? He does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't we at least turn off the phonograph?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It shuts off automatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you rig it to do that? You're so clever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  They all do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never know anymore. The SOUND OF THE TRAINER JET makes a low pass over Calvin's house.  Calvin sticks his head out the door and looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet that's a fighter jet on his way to Key West!  Good luck, amigo! INT. WORKSHOP They enter. The place is full of tools and gadgets-- mostly construction equipment. The ham radio is still on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An emergency has been declared. I repeat, an emergency has been declared. Calvin and Helen speak over the Tower who is telling other aircraft in the vicinity to clear the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear that?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Calvin unplugs the radio and quickly wraps the cord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can listen to the rest downstairs! He pushes aside a table that is hiding a hatch in the floor and unlocks it by turning the hatch's wheel.  Then he opens the hatch and reaches inside to turn on a light. Red submarine light shines up from below.  All the while he and Helen are chatting:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin, I wish you would have at least let me do the dishes. It's not going to be that easy getting all that dried- on food off my nice plates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just hope those plates aren't radioactive by tomorrow morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheese is particularly troublesome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worse than your Kraft Holiday dip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, much worse. But not as bad as that Mexican Jumping Bean dip. You remember that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, yeah. Okay.  Give me the roast and watch your step.  I'll come back for the radio. She steps into the hatch and onto a ladder. INT. JET - NIGHT The young pilot is bouncing around the now smokey cockpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tower, say again!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SAR HELO is airborne with you in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm marking the 180 radial for five and ejecting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roger, Wolf One. The pilot rights the plane; points the joy stick; and reaches for the ejection handles between his legs. EXT. JET The pilot ejects. INT. EMPTY COCKPIT This is the pilot's POV (were there a pilot.)  We see the coastline and we notice that the plane is making a... U- turn, away from the water and back towards the Valley. EXT. JET Streaking back to the Valley with a dramatic tail of sparks. EXT. THE PARACHUTING PILOT He notices that his plane is headed directly at him.  It misses him by a matter of yards. INT. LADDER - CONTINUOUS Taking the liberty of a CUTAWAY SECTION, we follow them down the ladder which is inside a corrugated metal tube. On either side of the tube we see layers of dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long will we have to stay down here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. For this thing to blow over, it could take days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Days??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rather safe than sorry. That's my motto!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, what if I go into labor? That could happen any time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've read up on it. I'll deliver the baby myself if I have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you listen to me Calvin Webber, when this baby comes, you're going to be out in the waiting room smoking yourself to death with all the other fathers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, dear!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As long as we've got that straight. EXT. JET - SAME TIME It COMPLETES ITS TURN and STREAKS SKYWARD at a 90 degree angle to the ground... until it SPUTTERS and the ENGINES STOP.  Then, after a Road Runner-like beat or two, it begins to FALL DIRECTLY BACK TO EARTH, tail first. INT. SMALL ANTEROOM - SAME TIME The Webbers step off a metal ladder and face a vault-like chrome hatchway.  Calvin opens the six-inch thick door by pushing another switch on his small box. Helen takes the roast. EXT. JET - NIGHT With only the sound of wind, the jet continues to fall as the lights of the Valley rush up to meet it. INT. SHELTER - CONTINUOUS They step into a darkened room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home sweet home!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To you maybe. Calvin flicks a wall switch and we HEAR A SERIES OF LIGHTS COMING ON.  The echoes of the sounds suggest a large, cavernous space.  All we can see is the cinder block wall behind them and the hatch door, which Calvin begins to shut by putting his body into it. Just then there is a TREMENDOUS DOUBLE EXPLOSION FROM ABOVE which knocks them to the floor. (Note: Helen hangs on to the roast, trying her best not to drop it.) The LADDER, CORRUGATED TUBE, ROOF, AND LOTS OR DIRT AND ROCK BEGIN TO CRASH DOWN INTO THE ANTEROOM. Calvin struggles to his feet and gets the vault door shut just in the nick of time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?! Hanging on to the roast she nods vigorously, trying to be brave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I think so. Calvin hurries to a bright RED METAL BOX on the wall. Next to the box is a LARGE THERMOMETER OR GAUGE that's labeled "Radiation Count."  There are OTHER GAUGES that are dropping to zero.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no!  It's happened!  Look at that heat!!  All my surface indicators are knocked out!  Oh, my Lord...it's actually happened!! INTER CUT - CU OF BOX AND THERMOMETER The box has a dial on it, next to which is a large lever. A foreboding sign reads  HATCHWAY TIME LOCKS, USE EXTREME CAUTION.  Calvin pulls the lever. BACK TO SCENE The chrome and steel EXIT HATCHWAY AUTOMATICALLY LOCKS with great noise, precision and...finality. There is the SOUND OF A REAR DOOR doing the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that noise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The locks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The locks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To keep us from trying to leave. After an atomic blast there's a radiation half-life that lasts thirty five years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty -five years!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then after that it's safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's safe. She continues to stare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To go up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To go up. She continues to stare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, honey. Don't you worry. We're going to be just fine. Helen bursts into tears. EXT WEBBER PATIO - DAY Two police detectives, LEVY and ATKINSON, exit the house. Uniformed workers carefully carry small pieces of the jet from the crash site. The detectives lead us to what's left of Calvin's shop. It's mostly a charred crater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: According to Caltech, this Webber guy was a bonafide genius and a borderline nutcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he and Mrs. Nutcase must have been out here when the plane hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless we get a postcard or somethin', that's my guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about relatives?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All back East.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The neighbors over there said the guy spent day and night out here. She'd bring him sandwiches and hot Dr. Pepper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drank it hot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good god.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. INT. MASTER BEDROOM - SAME TIME (12 HOURS AFTER BLAST) Helen awakes alone and still dressed. She sits up and trys the phone on the night table. It is dead. She hangs up and exits. INT. KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM/PATIO Calvin is making sandwiches from the pot roast. Two empty Doctor Pepper bottles sit next to the stove where Calvin is heating the soda. He sees Helen enter the livingroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, honey! Feeling better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to be strong, sweetheart. If not for ourselves, for the child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All our friends... He enters with her sandwich and a cup of Dr. Pepper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burnt to a crisp. (indicating sandwiches) I've given you the most well-done cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hot Dr. Pepper! Your favorite!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Calvin, you're favorite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? She walks out onto the patio. She rubs her arms as if cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bit chilly? Shouldn't be. Temperature's a nice 73 degrees. He follows her out to the patio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I've just got the creeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you?! This is just like home! A reverse angle shows for the first time the rest of the fallout shelter -- which looks very different from "home". Perhaps she starts to cry again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No! Calvin, this is different! Believe me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like a tranquilizer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have tranquilizers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you! I've got everything! Helen groans in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, oh. Now it's time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey? SCENE 29B OMITTED SCENE 29C OMITTED SCENE 29D OMITTED SCENE 29E OMITTED INT. VERY WIDE OF THE SHELTER - HOURS LATER We can only hear Adam's entrance into the world. There is Helen's pain, followed by Adam's cry, followed by Calvin's rejoicing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first child to be born on earth after the annihilation!! INT. SHELTER - DAYS LATER SUPER: SEVERAL DAYS LATER Start on the record player in the living room. The country and western classic "Hey, Good Looking" is spinning. OMIT SCENE 30 INT. SHELTER, BATTERY ROOM - SAME TIME Calvin walks through checking things over; pleased by what he sees.  He exits. ("Hey Good Looking" continues.) INT. SHELTER, FISH FARM - CONTINUOUS Calvin checks the switch he uses to control the lights. Then he checks out all the tiny fish swimming in the six feet by six feet tank.  When he hears a baby's cry he hurries away.(Music continues) INT. SHELTER, MASTER BEDROOM Calvin enters and smiles with great affection at his family:  Helen and a NEWBORN SON cradled next to her in bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Calvin.  Babies cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've noticed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What shall we call him? Calvin shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I was thinking...in light of the situation...that we should call him Adam.  That's not sacrilegious is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I think it's just right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I was wondering...if...if I could have a...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I...you know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Whatever you want, Helen! She points upwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want a bedroom ceiling. They both look up. Then he tells her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got it! Calvin happily gives her his patented thumbs-up sign. A MONTAGE:  1) CALVIN , IN A LARGE SUPPLY ROOM, PICKS OUT THE PLYWOOD HE'LL NEED FOR THE CEILINGS. ( 60'S HAPPY, BUSY SCORE COVERS ALL THIS.) 2) HELEN, CARRIES LITTLE ADAM (THREE DAYS OLD) ONTO THE FAKE PATIO (WITH THE PLASTIC PLANTS AND THE PLASTIC GRASS). SHE LOOKS UP AT CALVIN WHO'S ON A LADDER INSTALLING A CEILING. SUPER: SEVERAL WEEKS LATER 3) IN THE FAMILY ROOM, CALVIN SHOWS HELEN HOW HE'S RIGGED A PROJECTOR TO THROW A PICTURE ONTO THE TV SCREEN. SHE'S THRILLED TO SEE "THE HONEYMOONERS!" MAIN TITLES COME ON. ADAM, LYING ON A QUILT BY HELEN'S CHAIR, IS ABOUT FOUR WEEKS OLD. (IT'S IMPORTANT HERE THAT WE SEE A 8MM FILM BOX WITH THE "I LOVE LUCY" LOGO ON IT) SUPER: SEVERAL MONTHS LATER 4) TOTAL DARKNESS. THEN CALVIN FLICKS A SWITCH AND A BANK OF OVERHEAD LIGHTS COMES ON TO SIMULATE SUNLIGHT. UNDER THE LIGHTS ARE SOIL BEDS ON WOODEN TABLES. CALVIN IS EXCITED TO SHOW HELEN THE TINY, YOUNG CARROTS COMING UP. HELEN HOLDS ADAM AT THREE MONTHS OLD. SUPER: A YEAR LATER 5) IN THE DINING ROOM, HELEN IS SERVING POT ROAST AND SOME VERY NICE LOOKING CARROTS. ADAM IS SIX MONTHS OLD. HE WATCHES HIS PARENTS AS THEY SAY GRACE. 6) HELEN "SHOPS" FOR SUPPLIES IN THE LARGE STOREROOM. ADAM, ONE YEAR OLD, RIDES IN THE SHOPPING CART.(1963) 7) CALVIN NETS A WIGGLING, FULLY GROWN FISH. 8) THE FAMILY WATCHES "THE HONEYMOONERS" TOGETHER. (ADAM IS STILL ONE YEAR OLD.) CALVIN ENJOYS HIS PIPE IN THE LIVINGROOM 9) CALVIN EXAMINES THE REAR HATCHWAY AS HELEN APPROACHES WITH ADAM IN HER ARMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We looked all over for you. What are you doing back here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I was just examining this rear hatchway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No reason. (then, off her look) Well, it's pretty clear that the front entrance caved in when the bomb went off. So, you know, when the time is up, we'll have to return to the surface using, you know, this back entrance.  Which is very nice because it has the service elevator!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very nice. Unless it caved in, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Well... yes. A sober beat, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted to see me? Helen nods vigorously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? She sets Adam (one year old) down on his wobbly little legs, steadying him at the shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to Daddy, Adam. Go to Daddy. And Adam takes his first step. And then another! And another! It's a joyous event. CAMERA LEAVES THEM AND TRAVELS UPWARD THROUGH THE CEILING AND THEN, AGAIN USING THE DEVICE OF A CUTAWAY, IT CONTINUES THROUGH DIRT AND SEDIMENT ALL THE WAY UP TO THE SURFACE-- WHERE THE BACKYARD AVOCADO TREES ARE BEING BULLDOZED AND THE BACK FENCE HAS ALREADY BEEN TORN DOWN. THE WEBBER HOUSE FACED A QUIET RESIDENTIAL STREET, BUT IT BACKED ONTO VICTORY AVENUE (OR ONE OF THOSE VALLEY AVENUES) AND IN THE LATE FIFTIES AND EARLY SIXTIES THOSE MAIN THOROUGHFARES WENT COMMERCIAL. A SIGN tells us that this is the future site of MOM'S MALT SHOP." Some WORKMEN with shovels have discovered the REAR SHELTER DOORS where they have been digging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Boss! The construction BOSS comes over for a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you make of this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn if I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet it's some kinda septic tank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never seen a septic tank that looked like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, don't fool with it. If it is a septic tank, I sure as hell don't want to open it. We'll just lay the foundation over it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. EXT. WEBBER HOUSE, PATIO (THE REAL ONE) - DAY, SAME TIME A Realtor steps out with A COUPLE looking to buy the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and since it's almost certain that the Webbers were killed, the bank is selling the house and that back parcel over there that's been re-zoned commercial. It's right there on the avenue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that where the plane crashed? She points out to a LEVEL LAWN where the shop used to be. We can see the Malt Shop construction crew beyond that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep, right there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place gives me the willies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know what you mean. But the price is right. EXT. BACK AT THE MALT SHOP CONSTRUCTION SIGHT - CONTINUOUS, DAY The guy driving the heavy front loader lets the bucket slam to the ground hard. INT. BACK AT THE SHELTER REAR DOOR - CONTINUOUS Calvin vaguely hears the noise made by the front loader. INT. SHELTER, LIVING ROOM - EVENING (1965-66) SUPER: 1965 Calvin smokes his pipe and enjoys a Manhattan cocktail as Adam (three and a half) sits in his lap reading the title page from Alice in Wonderland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Al ice in won der lan. Calvin smiles pridefully over at Helen who works intensely on the couch making a coffee-can Santa from instructions in the The Redbook Crafts Collection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not bad for a three and a half year old! I'd like to see the public school system match that! I don't care how terrific it is!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, he's very bright, dear. Much like his father. But you know, Calvin, maybe he's a little...young for school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nonsense. People have no idea what the human mind is capable of. Look at us! Helen ponders that statement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Daddy. Alice went down a hole, just like us. Calvin smiles and messes up Adam's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will I ever get to go up on top?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you certainly will. And you'll find a nice girl and rebuild America. Just the way it used to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Calvin, I'm not sure we should be making promises that perhaps can't be kept.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe there will be other survivors. In fact, I'm guessing there's life on the surface, even now. It's not life worth living perhaps, but believe me, something's moving around up there. And I don't just mean the cockroaches. They both look nervously up at the ceiling. EXT. MOM'S MALT SHOP (NOW FINISHED) - DAY (1965-66) CARS PASS BY on the busy avenue. INT. MOM'S MALT SHOP - CONTINUOUS CLEAN CUT SURFER KIDS are being served their favorite ice- cream and malt treats by MOM herself and a young SODA JERK. Appropriate music comes from the jukebox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to need two more banana- splits and a cherry coke!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet, Mom! Coming up! Two YOUNG MEN IN BEATLE HAIRCUTS enter. Everyone looks at them in amazement. (Perhaps there is also a record change here.) INT. SHELTER, CLASSROOM - DAY (65-66) Calvin is building and furnishing a classroom from materials available to him. He has had the forethought to bring down the books needed for his child's education. Little Adam is watching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing in the world is more fun than learning new things. INT. FAMILY ROOM - NIGHT The family watches the same "Honeymooner" clip they watched before. Calvin still finds it funny. Helen wonders about that. INT. BEDROOM - LATER Helen is pouring cooking sherry into an empty Listerine bottle. EXT. MALT SHOP - DAY (1970-71) SUPER: 1970 Other buildings have been constructed around the malt shop. Foot and car traffic are heavier. INT. MALT SHOP - SAME TIME The clean-cut kids have been replaced by FLOWER CHILDREN. Mom hasn't put a lot back into the decor, but she has made concessions to the fashions of the time. The jukebox plays something appropriate. Mom and the Jerk are five years older.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't tell the boys from the girls anymore!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh...yeah. It's like hard. Mom gives the Jerk a suspicious look. INT. SHELTER - DAY (1970-71) Calvin (40) is giving Adam (8) a boxing lesson. They work from a "How To" book and use gloves made from living room pillows. Adam's pretty good. Helen appears and watches with pride. Then she interupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boys! Excuse me, but I believe it's my turn. (holding out her hand) Adam? He goes to her. INT. SHELTER - MINUTES LATER The hydroponic garden area is empty. A Perry Como song begins and Adam and Helen enter waltzing. Adam has changed shirts and combed his hair. Somewhere, Calvin is watching with pride. After a while Calvin cuts in. He and Helen dance beautifully. Then they kiss. Somewhere, Adam is watching with pride. INT. MALT SHOP - DAY (1975-76) SUPER: 1975 The place continues its decline. Acid rock plays loudly. Mom and the Jerk serve the smallish crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss those nice flower-power kids. How 'bout you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um...uh... The acid rock song ends and an early, bad disco hit comes on the jukebox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell kind of music is that?! The Jerk puts his hands to his ears, he so hates the new music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, man. I'm like not sure I like that. INT. SHELTER, CLASSROOM  (1975-76) The room looks like Ricky Nelson's class.  There are twin pictures of Ike and JFK on the wall.  Adam is eleven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what money looks like.  It comes like this, in coin, or like this in paper.  Or you can have an "investment."  These are stock "certificates" that we bought in your name.  Of course, they're worthless now, but at one time they were quite valuable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're pretty.  Can I have them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Now, let's move on to our French exam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Latin exam, Dad.  It's Tuesday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right!  It's Tuesday already! By gosh, time flies, doesn't it?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tempus fugit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: En arte voluptus. Que les bons temps roulE!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerade aus dann links!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorgen sie bitte dafur das die gepack sorgfaltic behandeldt warren!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haben sie etuas nettes in leder?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you have a wonderful sense of humor, son!  I must say, the acorn doesn't fall very far from the tree. By the way, it's time I gave you something. Come with me. Adam follows his dad out. INT. SHUFFLEBOARD COURT - CONTINUOUS They pass Helen who is absentmindedly poking at the puck with a stick. She's not having a very good day. She wears her hair dryer but it's not plugged in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, honey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. INT. BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Calvin hands Adam a cigar box. Adam opens it to see Calvin's remarkable baseball card collection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are wonderful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my entire baseball collection. It's yours now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's baseball?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a game, son. I can explain it pretty easily. There's a pitcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a painting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, son. A pitcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like one of Mom's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, no. There's a man who throws the ball -- to a man who has a bat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nocturnal flying mammal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Sit down. They do. INT. SHELTER - NIGHT Start close on flashing roller skates. Then cut wider to show Adam roller skating. He passes Helen who has fallen asleep knitting in one of the lawn chairs. Then Adam passes Calvin who is on a ladder soldering a leaking ceiling pipe. EXT. MALT SHOP - DAY (1991) SUPER: 1991 TWO PUNKS with spiked green hair enter to the strains of "My Sharona." INT. MALT SHOP - DAY (1991) Mom watches the punks enter. Then crosses to the Soda Jerk who now has a tattoo on his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm selling this place.  I want out of this hell hole!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could I, like...oh, wow...like,uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buy it from me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah!  Yeah, that's it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give it to ya, no money down. The neighborhood has gone to hell anyway. She walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool. INT. KITCHEN  (1995) SUPER: 1995 Helen has prepared a birthday cake. Having no birthday candles, she's used three votive candles. We can hear Calvin and Adam talking in the dining room. (She and Calvin are now in their 60's.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no! The runner on second goes to third! He's out there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he's forced out at third! It's a force!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why go there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he must!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming! Calvin enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, dear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the presents and do the lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet. Calvin leaves while Helen lights the candles. The whole shelter goes dark. Calvin returns with two presents wrapped in whatever is available. INT. DINING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Helen and Calvin enter singing Happy Birthday. We see the ADULT ADAM for the first time in silhouette. His handsome face is revealed to us when the cake is placed before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Mom! Thanks, Dad!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blow out the candles!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make a wish! He does both. His parents clap. Helen takes one of the presents from Calvin and gives it to Adam. He unwraps it. It's a green coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, boy! A jacket!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mom made that all by herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No kidding!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No kidding. (aside, to Calvin) Who else would have done it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I made these! He gives Adam the second present. Adam tears off the paper to find a pair of roller-skates that Calvin has redesigned. The new skates look kind of like rollerblades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy Cow! What the heck are these?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your roller-skates! I redesigned them! I think this new design will work even better!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are really swell! I mean swell!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you wish for, Adam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he tells, it won't come true!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that's just a bunch of baloney! We never believed that in my family!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we did in my family!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wished I could meet a girl. His parents don't have a reply for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. A nice one, I hope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One who doesn't glow in the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin Webber! What a thing to say!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we'll be going up in two years. We'll know then. I'm very hopeful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too. His parents stare at him for a beat, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's eat our cake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Let's dig in! They do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elbows, Son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Mom!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never know. You may someday dine at the White House with the president.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we still have one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, when we do go up...I'm going to miss this old place. How 'bout you, hon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Helen rises and exits. SCENE 48 OMITTED SCENE 49 OMITTED SCENE 50 OMITTED SCENE 51 OMITTED SCENE 52 OMITTED SCENE 53 OMITTED SCENE 54 OMITTED SCENE 55 OMITTED SCENE 56 OMITTED SCENE 57 OMITTED SCENE 58 OMITTED INT. BATTERY ROOM- LATER, SAME NIGHT Helen enters and goes into the generator room. Through the glass we can see (and hear) her scream. Straightening her hair and feeling much better, she exits as Calvin strolls by wearing his tool belt. She's headed out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the generator room again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes.  It just fascinates me how all    these things work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know exactly what you mean! (then) Hey, honey? She turns to him. He gives her his patented thumbs up sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great cake!! She smiles wanely and leaves. He shuts the generator door she left open. SCENE 60 OMITTED SCENE 61 OMITTED INT.SHELTER, LIVING ROOM - VERY EARLY MORNING SUPER: THE PRESENT The room is quiet and empty.  The star-burst WALL CLOCK on the paneling says 6:15. INT. SHELTER, KITCHEN - SAME TIME Also empty. INT. STOREROOM - SAME TIME Also empty.  And with MEAGER SUPPLIES on the shelves. INT. POWER AND PUMP ROOM - SAME TIME The old pipes are rusted and patched. Some are leaking badly. INT. MASTER BEDROOM - SAME TIME Calvin wakes up. He looks over at Helen's bed. ANGLE - HELEN She wakes up. Then jumps out of bed. SCENE 67 OMITTED CLOSE ON THE RED METAL BOX that has been ticking on the wall for thirty-five years. Suddenly it STOPS TICKING and a rather annoying ALARM GOES OFF.  Calvin's hand reaches up and turns it off by throwing the lever up. ANOTHER ANGLE shows us the mechanism on the FRONT HATCHWAY switch to OPEN with a loud, vault-like move. ANOTHER ANGLE reveals the family in their pajamas standing in front of the front hatchway and red box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...we just open this door and go up? Calvin grabs a handle and using all his strength, opens the front entrance hatch. And then must jump back when nothing but earth and rock pour into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um...is that supposed to happen? His parents take a beat then race off like maniacs through the entire shelter to the back hatch door.  They knock over whatever gets in their way as they go. Adam follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, where are we going?!  Is everything all right?! INT. BACK HATCHWAY - MOMENTS LATER Calvin and Helen arrive followed by Adam who can't possibly share his parent's deep concerns. Everyone is out of breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we say a little prayer first?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just open the door. Calvin attempts to open the big hatch, but can't.  Adam helps him.  Helen pitches in.  Slowly, with lots of squeaking, the DOOR OPENS. He steps through the hatch and flips a wall switch.  Red submarine LIGHTS COME ON.... And the service elevator is intact. INT. ANTEROOM - CONTINUOUS Helen steps through and embraces Calvin joyfully.  The old folks break into a dance as Adam enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, do we just go on up?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, son! We wait for night.  Now...is precisely when... we must be at our... most cautious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit. Helen's eyes widen and her hand flies up to her mouth. She is just as shocked as Calvin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen-Thomas-Webber!  Maybe we have been down here a little too long! (to Adam) Please excuse her French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit is a French word?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes it is!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an archaic colloquialism, roughly meaning..."good".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! That's right!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. (then) Well...then...shit! There is a pause, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'est bon, Monsieur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merci! SCENE 71 OMITTED EXT. THE MALT SHOP - NIGHT Cars flash by in a rare L.A. DOWNPOUR.  All that's left of Mom's is an EMPTY BUILDING with a painted-out front window and a "For Sale or Rent" sign.  There's ANOTHER SHOP attached to it CAMERA RIGHT but we can't see what it is.  The alley way on the left has always been there. INT. MALT SHOP - CONTINUOUS TWO DRUNK BUMS are sharing a bottle. One of them is the Soda Jerk, now a  dissipated middle-aged man (with a tattoo on his forehead.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...all of these things...Alcoholics Anonymous...Cocaine Anonymous...Heroin Anonymous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a Heroin Anonymous?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! All of these things... ask you to believe in a power greater than yourself! Some sort of God on High! Well...I have lifted my eyes skyward a time or two... and I have certainly not seen anything coming from up there except a goddamn airplane -- that I can't afford to get on! The cement FLOOR of the old Malt Shop begins to QUIVER AND RUMBLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earthquake!  Another earthquake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let her come!  Let's get this over with!  And please, if there is a God, let it be worse in Bel Air!! The Other Bum staggers to his feet and SPLITS for a back window.  Soda Jerk is fearless.  Until finally the HYDRAULIC DOORS of the back entrance SPLIT THE FLOOR with an eerie, struggling whine and LARGE CHUNKS OF CEMENT GO FLYING.  Then up comes RED SUBMARINE LIGHT followed by Calvin in his BIG YELLOW SUIT with Geiger counter ticking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God!  Oh, God!!  Oh,God, save me!! For I have seen the light!! Calvin raises his hand and yells through his mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I come in peace!! The Soda Jerk FAINTS. Calvin, sounding like a deep sea diver and having to walk like Frankenstein, goes over to the Soda Jerk and studies his face in the light of his flashlight.  He is horrified by what he sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My, gosh... Calvin looks around the room and heads for the back.  He moves his Geiger counter around and gets a quiet (safe) reading. Then he removes a KITCHEN MATCH from a plastic container and strikes it against the wall.  The MATCH BURNS, so Calvin takes off his hood and visor and breathes the air.  It stinks in there. EXT. MALT SHOP - MOMENTS LATER, RAINING Calvin (out of the head gear and top of the suit) slowly pushes the door open and steps out. He's surprised to find an empty BODY SHOP behind the Malt Shop, where the avocado trees should be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is my backyard? He points his flashlight around and heads for the ALLEY to his left. EXT. ALLEY - A MOMENT LATER, RAINING DERELICT CARS left over from the Body Shop sit against a fence. Calvin marvels at the cars, even in their present condition.  In a TIGHTER SHOT he studies the chrome- plated word "Toyota."   A HOMELESS MAN arrives to search through the garbage. Calvin hurries back towards the avenue. SCENE 76 OMITTED EXT. MALT SHOP - TEN MINUTES LATER, RAIN Calvin emerges from the alley that separates the Malt Shop from another storefront (perhaps now a rundown Thai restaurant.) CLOSER ON HIM watching the cars fly by on the wet avenue.  Suddenly, a cross-dressing STREET WALKER steps up to him with a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a light, honey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!  A light!  Yes, I've got a light!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Fumbling, he finally gets her little cigar lighted with one of his kitchen matches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...you...survived the blast, did you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blast?  Honey, I have survived a host of things. Like the song says: "A country boy can survive!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes, the song.  So tell me...has it been...hell up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Hell up here?"  Honey, it's been hell up here, down there and over yonder! Hell everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I can tell that just looking around. (then) "Boy?"  Did you say you were a "country boy?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cute Little Old Man, if you want a boy, I can be a boy.  And if you want a girl, I can be a girl.  I can be anything you want me to be!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh. And it's all yours for the remarkably low price of only $200! And if you act now, I might even throw in some free lawn furniture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I can't.  I'm sorry!  I have to go!  I have to... He breaks into a trot, heading up the street past a seedy BAR (used to be the convenience store) just as a hopelessly DRUNK HAG of a woman is shoved out and told to stay out.  Calvin watches as the woman stumbles to the curb where she TOSSES her cookies.  TWO LOW RIDERS HOP BY full of TAUNTING YOUNG HISPANIC GANG MEMBERS, one of whom BRANDISHES A PISTOL and, just for fun, points it at Calvin.  When Calvin sees the pistol he ducks into the ADULT BOOKSTORE. The young gang member pulls the trigger and we (not Calvin) see that the realistic-looking pistol is really a water gun. INT. ADULT BOOK AND VIDEO STORE Calvin races in and, gathering himself, addresses the PAKISTANI MAN behind the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello!  How are you this evening?! Mind if I, you know, browse around?! The clerk just watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank-Q very much! Then Calvin turns and has his first look at the material...and he GRABS HIS HEART and SCREAMS and FALLS back KNOCKING OVER a whole ROW OF VIDEOS AND MAGAZINES. INT. SHELTER, KITCHEN - AN HOUR LATER Calvin sits at the breakfast table, still breathing hard and holding his chest.  His family looks on with great concern.  The anti-radiation suit and gear is piled in the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to give it to you straight. There's no point in beating around the bush. There were survivors. Apparently, the fallout has created....a subspecies of mutants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mutants?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a pretty sight. Some eat out of garbage cans.  Others are...cover your ears, Son, and hum.  I mean that literally and I mean right now! ADAM covers his ears and hums.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Others are...multi-sexual.  It seems...they can be both masculine and feminine...simultaneously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe it! Helen copes by moving around the kitchen doing things that don't need to be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe it. He tried to sell me his body, Helen. (beat) They offer lawn furniture as a come on! She slumps, then resumes her needless activity.  Calvin takes Adam's arm and the son drops his hands and stops humming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've done a lot of re-building but society, at least as we knew it, has utterly collapsed. People throw up in the streets. Others point guns. There's something terribly wrong with the automobiles and...and I...I can't tell you the rest.  I just can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my. Oh,my, oh my, oh, my. So, what do we do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We stay down here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. She hurries into the living room. INT. LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Helen let's out a silent scream, then hurries back into the kitchen. INT. KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS HELEN For how long?  We've just about run out of everything!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll make do.  I'm of the opinion that these mutants will eventually kill each other off and then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Calvin.  We're not going to make do.  Not me!  Not Adam.  We're going up no matter what!  We deserve it. Even if it's terrible!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I am the head of this household--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want him to at least see the sky!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --and we will--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the ocean!  A mountain range!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --do as I say! Breathing heavily, Calvin suddenly clutches at his chest in great pain and collapses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no! Oh, my goodness!   Let's get him into the bedroom. INT. HALLWAY - HOURS LATER Adam paces.  Then Helen comes out.  Behind her, we can see Calvin sleeping in his bed. She heads for the living room. He follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seems to be doing all right now.  I don't know if he's had a heart attack or just... a horrifying experience. But we  need supplies and I've got to stay with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go up. They go through the living room and cross to the patio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid you've got to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're my brave boy. Helen hands him a pencil and pad. Adam follows her to the fish farm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just act normal.  If anybody asks, simply say you're from out-of-town, and that you're in town on business. Write that down. He does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to give you a shopping list and some money.  We need just enough things to get us through the next year or two.  And you'll find most of these items at what used to be called a grocery store or a hardware store. Write that down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am. At the fish tank, Helen pulls up a slim chain that is attached to a water-tight aluminum box which she quickly opens. The box contains $6,000 in wrapped one hundred dollar bills. Helen takes half of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how far you'll have to travel to find supplies, but if you can't get home by nightfall, I want you to look for something called a Holiday Inn. Write that down. It's a hotel. There might still be one standing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get you packed. She heads back for the house. He follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just hope this is still good up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking that, uh...you know, while I was up there and all...that maybe I could, you know...try to meet a girl.  I've, been thinking about that a little...just these last...fifteen years or so. They have stopped by the garden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Adam,that would be wonderful if you could find a girl. One who's not a mutant...and hopefully comes from Pasadena. Nothing against Valley girls, but in my day anyhow, the girls from Pasadena, I don't know...always just seemed a little nicer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am. They hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, there's also a thing called a liquor store. Write that down. INT. ADAM'S ROOM - AN HOUR LATER He is packing. He looks at his cigar box and opens it. He studies the contents: The Cards, stock certificates, and an old photo of his parents. He decides to pack the box. Helen enters with a long shopping list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's the shopping list and $3,000 which should take care of everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father has a few final words for you. You know, he'd fight a buzz saw for you - he loves you so much. We both do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heck, I know that mom! You're my parents. INT. MASTER BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Adam sets down his suitcase and goes to his father's bed. He sits. At the door, Helen dries her eyes with her apron.  Calvin indicates that he wants to whisper to Adam, who drops his ear close to his father's lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam...don't forget...don't forget ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, father?! Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the pipe tobacco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.  Is that all? Calvin nods. Adam rises and starts for the door. But Calvin remembers something and beckons him back to speak weakly into his son's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Also...stay out of the "Adult Bookstore."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adult Bookstore.  Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poison gas. Invisible. Don't forget.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise. Is that all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more thing. If you find a healthy young woman, bring her back with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll try. And then Calvin closes his eyes and sleeps. INT. MALT SHOP - SAME DAY The Soda Jerk has turned the rear exit into a religious shrine.  He's put flowers and candles and costume jewelry and religious icons (from all the Majors) on top of and around the broken cement.  Currently he's on his knees, rocking back and forth as he prays. And,lo! There came a rumbling even as from the very bowels of the earth and a great light showed forth followed by gates of armor which opened and shut and delivered up the vision of a young man whose countenance caused the Soda Jerk to be struck dumb and to fall on his face and to weep in fear.  And, Adam, taking pity on the man, put down his suitcase, and went to him, saying:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!  Yes!  Oh, Lord!  Yes, oh, yes! But  where is the one who came last night -- all in yellow?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All in yellow?  Oh!  That was my father!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooooohhhh!!  Of course! The father! Forgive me!!  Can you forgive me for my wasted life?!  Everything has been so awful!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it has been terrible.  But it wasn't your fault. And now all the decay is over with and things are going to get better. You understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to go, now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you do.  I'll stay here and pray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's always a good idea! Would you like some money? I have a great deal of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I don't need money anymore -- I see that now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I leave here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The front door is open.  Will you be back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise. Adam turns and leaves. The Soda Jerk falls to his knees and shakes all over. EXT. MALT SHOP - CONTINUOUS Adam steps out onto the sidewalk and sunlight falls on him much brighter than anything he has ever seen.  He looks at it on the arm of his coat and then, slowly, he looks up at the sky. INTERCUT - LOVELY CLOUDS AND BLUE SKY And now it is Adam who is dumbstruck. BYSTANDER #1 appears and sees Adam looking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  What is it?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sky!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sky?  Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up there!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see anything!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just look!! Adam becomes momentarily interested in a parking meter. A MOTHER and her CHILD approach from the other direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sees something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see it, mommy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?! Several more people are drawn over. A CONVERTIBLE goes by in the foreground with passengers who are looking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have never in my life seen anything like this!!!! Nothing even comes close!! Adam continues down the sidewalk,looking up. A BLACK WOMAN POSTAL WORKER passes by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatcha looking at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my holy stars! A Negro!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say what?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you do, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good! The Pakistani exits the Adult Bookstore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?!  What do you see?! When Adam looks down to answer the man he sees the "Adult Bookstore" sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poisonous gas!!  Run for your life, it's invisible poisonous gas!!! And everyone does run away, including Adam. The avenue is left totally deserted. INT. KITCHEN NOOK - SAME DAY Helen sits sipping tea, deep in thoughts of concern for Adam. Behind her Calvin appears in the open window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know-- Helen is so startled she knocks the tea all over the place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just wanted to say that I think he's going to be just fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Calvin. Thank you very much. Calvin leaves, then comes back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's smart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, dear, I know. SCENE 85A OMITTED EXT. CORNER BUS STOP - AFTERNOON, SAME DAY An L.A. bus comes directly at CAMERA. ANGLE - THE DRIVER is startled. He reacts. ANGLE - DRIVER'S FOOT slamming down the brake pedal. ANGLE - ADAM in profile. The braking bus stops an inch from his nose. Adam smiles. (Have him head for bus door in this angle.) ANGLE - THE DRIVER from over Adam. He is in shock. INT. BUS - A MOMENT LATER Start on a MOVING STEADY CAM SHOT on Adam's POV of bus passengers as he heads for a seat. The passengers look at him in amazement and some fear. ANGLE - ADAM going to his seat; smiling at the passengers. (He is carrying a $100 bill.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello! Hi. Good afternoon! Howdy. Adam finds a seat next to a heavily perspiring young PSYCHO HEROIN ADDICT. ANOTHER ANGLE OF THEM Adam shows the Psycho the $100 bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to give the driver this but he wouldn't take it. He seems angry. A lot of people do. The bus pulls out. It gets up to about twenty miles an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, boy! Here we go! We're moving! Wow. INTERCUT: PASSENGERS looking back at Adam with concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So this is public transportation. My Dad says that it becomes more and more important because of pollution -- which is more and more carbon dioxide and other hazardous gases in the air. (then, confidentially) Do you have a gun, by the way? The increasingly nervous Psycho looks around, then nods that he does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thanks for not waving it around. And for not vomitting, for that matter. Wow, we're really flying. Say, do you know where I could find a grocery store? The psycho shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to find that. And a hardware store  and a liquour store and a standing Holiday Inn. Although, I may not need the Holiday Inn. That's still kind of up in the air. It depends really on how things go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a grocery store coming up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank-Q! (jumping up) Driver! Please stop the bus immediately! I have to get off! (then an aside to the psycho) Do you think I should get a gun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Driver! Please stop, sir! INTERCUT - DRIVER IN THE REAR VIEW He's not going to stop until he wants to stop. ANGLE - OLD JEWISH COUPLE PASSENGERS. who are anxious for Adam to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the love of God! Let him off the bus!! Can't you see he's meshugina! Adam leans in close to the OLD MAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, what did you call me? The man and his wife take that the wrong way and start to scream. ANGLE - THE DRIVER'S FOOT hitting the brakes. EXT.- BUS stopping suddenly. Through the windows we see Adam go down. INT. BUS - CONTINUOUS The back door opens as Adam gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, driver! Good-bye, everyone! Adam exits the bus. Everyone, including the Psycho, heaves a huge sign of relief. INT. SUPER MARKET - MINUTES LATER Adam enters and (after getting over the automatic doors and the check-out technology) is overwhelmed by the magnificence of the postmodern California supermarket. The check-out counters alone are amazing. Seeing others do it, he takes a cart, placing his suitcase in it. INT. BAKERY COUNTER Adam passes the baked goods, paying particular attention to the elaborate birthday cakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that a birthday cake?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee-ma-nee! Adam leaves. The clerk turns to a fellow worker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bakersfield. INT. AISLE Adam marvels at the abundance and variety. He passes a mother whose child is riding in the cart and that reminds him of his own mom -- when she used to let him ride that way.  Then he is surprised to see a MIDDLE-AGED COUPLE so casually dressed in public. She (overweight) is in an unfortunate terrycloth halter-shorts combination.  He (hirsute) is in a sleeveless undershirt and baggy bathing trunks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My first mutants. INT. FRESH PRODUCE Adam picks up one of those huge California cucumbers that always amaze Easterners.  He shows it to the JAPANESE- AMERICAN CLERK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this because of the radiation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. INT. MEAT COUNTER Adam is looking at the live lobsters as a BUTCHER steps up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, please. (consulting his Mom's list) I'm looking for all beef patties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fresh or frozen? Adam chuckles because he thinks the man is kidding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. Frozen. How much are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frozen, they're six-thirty a dozen in the three pound box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'll need, twelve into nine hundred, seventy-five boxes. And that's almost...five hundred dollars just for the hamburger! And my Mom only gave me three thousand dollars for everything! The yacht batteries! The diesel oil! The birthday candles!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could have a meat order that big delivered to your home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's great then! Terrific...except...it just occurred to me. I don't know where I live! I'm lost! I don't know where home is! (then) Would you excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gladly. Adam hurries away. SCENE 93 OMITTED SCENE 94 OMITTED A MONTAGE of Adam on another bus. He looks frantically out the window. We see his POV of shops and stores and people. At one point he sees two women joggers which he wonders about. Then he sees two men arguing violently. Gradually late day turns to night and Adam becomes more and more depressed. Then he sees something. He is elated. He jumps up and tells the driver:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Driver! Stop this bus immediately! Please sir!! EXT. - VENTURA BLVD - NIGHT The bus stops mid-block and Adam gets off. He crosses the street causing only one car to hit the brakes. On the other side of the avenue we see what has gotten his attention. It's an ADULT BOOKSTORE much like the last one we saw (probably owned by the same chain.) He's happy but when he looks next door he sees he's in a different place. Sad and lost he turns north and starts to walk until -- a billboard catches his attention. We pan up to see a billboard for liposuction that features an almost NUDE WOMAN. Adam is struck by the image and we spend some time cutting between him and it. Then gathering himself he turns and begins to walk south. ANOTHER ANGLE of him as he passes a BODY PIERCING STORE and wonders about that. Then he sees something that blows his mind. WIDER ANGLE of a STRAY DOG passing by. Adam reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my. Oh, my goodness gracious! Oh, my...Oh. That is so great!! Man alive! ANGLE - CU OF BASEBALL CARDS STORE WINDOW A sign says: COMIC BOOKS & BASEBALL CARDS BOUGHT, SOLD & TRADED. INT. CARD AND COMIC STORE - MOMENTS LATER Adam enters with his suitcase in one hand and his cigar box in the other.  He steps up to the counter where the owner (JERRY) sits reading the newspaper. He has a fondness for Navajo jewelry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. A YOUNG WOMAN enters from the back of the store and goes to another counter.  Neither man notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The name is Adam Webber and I see you buy baseball cards and although these are a lot older than the ones in the window, I was hoping you still might be interested. He flips open the cigar box to reveal to Jerry riches beyond his wildest dreams.  Jerry actually moans and then must pretend the moan was a cough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How--how much do you want for the Mickey Mantle, rookie season?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking of selling all the cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? No kidding? He reaches in and looks through the cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, my problem is, all I have are hundred dollar bills and I need something smaller.  Ones, fives, tens. Like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see what ya mean. Tell you what...I'll give you five hundred dollars in small bills for the whole box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that would be wonderful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're here to help! A woman steps into the shot. She has come from the back of the store and her back is momentarily to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit! Adam turns to her and is immediately awe struck. We reveal EVE RUSTOKOV. She tosses her lipstick into her purse. Eve works in the card shop and is on her way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm workin' here, Evey-poo.  Don't screw me up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bon soir, mademoiselle!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you French?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (then, thinking fast) I'm from out of town. (then sensing the need for further clarification) I'm here on business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, your business must not be sports memorabilia, because this one Mantle card right here-- (holds up a card) --is worth six thousand dollars all by its little self.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you get out of here. She closes his cigar box and gives it to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terrific...you're fired! You know that?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ferry--excuse me, Jerry, I quit. She walks back to the counter to get her coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no! I fired ya! Just like the hair salon guy and the Chevy dealer!  You know why you can't keep a goddamn job?!  Because you can't keep your goddamn mouth shut!  That's why! Jerry is surprised when Adam suddenly takes his arm firmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir? I would really appreciate it if you wouldn't take the Lord's name in vain again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you got a problem with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a big problem with that. Eve sees a fist fight coming. She takes Adam by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Heathcliff, I'll walk you to the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.  But my name is Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just come on. They head for the door and exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hah!  Adam and Eve!  The perfect match!  I hope you two will be very happy together!  Mazel-fuckin'-tov! Don't try coming back, Ms. Big Shot! I'm serious this time! You're finished in the hobby business! Take that to the bank, why don'tcha! Adam re-enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to leave without saying how much I admire your jewelry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, smart ass, how 'bout I kick your butt? Adam walks towards the man smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout you what? Jerry takes a nervous step backwards, but Eve steps back in and pulls Adam out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said come on! Adam exits. Jerry doesn't know what to say. EXT. CARD STORE - NIGHT They exit the store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We? I'm going home. And, judging by that coat, I'd say you have to get back to the barber college.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lost?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say,...did you just lose your job because of me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it.  I'm sick of working for that dickhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dickhead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A walking penis capable of intelligent speech.  A dickhead. A mental picture of that causes Adam to slump against a store window and drop his box of cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just had a mental picture of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, pick these up! Together they pick up the cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you parked?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came on a bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why doesn't that surprise me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Why doesn't it? They rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I guess because I'm a little psychic...I have this thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that's nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me guess something. This is your first visit to La La Land. You're staying somewhere over in Hollywood because, like an idiot, you thought that would be an exciting place to stay.  Right so far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it! So anyhow, you get on a bus and before you know it, you're out here in the San Fernando Valley without a clue.  Which brings us to here.  Correct again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you staying? The Holiday Inn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Yes! The Holiday Inn! That's exactly right!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See? I'm psychic. Not completely, but pretty much. That was pretty good, wasn't it?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was amazing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Thanks. Anyhow, let me predict a bus for you to get on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you own a car? EVE I'm not taking you there, Sweetie. Rule Number One in North America: No strangers in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it will make you feel any better, I don't have a gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that changes everything. Get the fuck away from me!!  I mean it!! She races around the corner.  He goes after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry!  I said something wrong, didn't I!  Please forgive me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from me!! She runs into a parking lot.  He follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! Please wait!  I'll make a deal with you!  I'll give you a Rogers Hornsby, if you'll take me to the hotel!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rogers Hornsby?!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's all yours. I was holding him back. Adam takes a Hornsby card from his coat pocket and shows it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rogers Hornsby's worth like four thousand dollars!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what?!  I've got two of him! (removing more cards from his pocket) And this many DiMaggios and Robinsons. I was holding these out, too. She arrives at her car (dirty GEO) and anxiously unlocks the driver's door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So for four thousand dollars, all I have to do is drive you to your hotel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction
